description.narrative: 1) Communities of different ethnicity solve their conflicts in a non-violent way and are less receptive of violence instigating propaganda (hate speech, ethnic violence etc.). 2) Communities enjoy good vertical relationships and improved services (security, humanitarian support and development) from local authorities and service providers
Main stakeholder groups in the community, including youth, women, traditional authorities, traders, IDPs and local government

Peace from Below is a program which includes two key projects (APP and P2P). The program supports conflict resolution and reconciliation in the target communities to leverage changes that can positively influence the conflict dynamics across the region and which may then influence the national political / military and ethnic conflict that has devastated South Sudan since December 2013. Peace from Below has also had a very specific focus on gender and the role of women in local peacebuilding which is intended to contribute to the implementation of United Nations Security Council Resolution 1325 on the community level.

Port has been implemented by PAX and its local partner since 2015 to promote cross border peaceful coexistence and inter / intra community and tribal peaceful coexistence in three communities, Yirol, Amongpiny (Lakes) and Payinjiar (Unity). The project supports conflict resolution and reconciliation in these communities to leverage changes that can influence the conflict dynamics across the region. Since 2017, the P2P project has also a very specific focus on gender promoting the participation of women in local peacebuilding which is intended to contribute to the implementation of United Nations Security Council Resolution 1325 on the community level.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 19318 3501 DH Utrecht The Netherlands

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: South Sudan: Our vision, Our Future (NAP 1325)
